intro: Cocos mikaniana, commonly known as the Mexican coconut or the red coconut, is a flowering plant in the Arecaceae family. It is native to southern Mexico and parts of Central America, where it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant produces a unique red or orange fruit that contains a single large seed, distinguishing it from other coconut species. Its leaves are palmate, with long, narrow segments, and it can grow up to 10 meters in height. The fruit is often used in local cuisines and has traditional medicinal uses in indigenous communities.
